definition: the future is long (idiom); there will be ample time for that later/We'll cross that bridge when we get there
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sun/day/date, day of the month

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter

sentences.english: That's a long way off but it's not too early to make plans.
sentences.chinese: 儘管來日方長，但是及早打算總沒錯。

sentences.english: There's still time, the sun just single phosphor.
sentences.chinese: 來日方長，太陽只是顆啓明星。

sentences.english: Happiness comes to those who truly deserve it…
sentences.chinese: 的確，真正的幸福，來日方長。

sentences.english: Youth is short if not, who wanted to come to Japan long.
sentences.chinese: 若非青春苦短，誰會想來日方長。

sentences.english: Levi could have a long political career ahead of her.
sentences.chinese: 利瓦伊的政治生涯來日方長。
